Package eu.infomas.dropbox

An easy to use, OSGi based Java client for the Dropbox REST API v1, runs on Google App Engine.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Account Information about a user's account.
Credentials Credentials holds the key (identifier) and secret token pair used in the OAuth protocol and REST requests.
DeltaEntry A single entry in a DeltaPage.
DeltaPage A page of DeltaEntrys, returned by Dropbox.delta(java.lang.String).
Dropbox DropBox offers an easy-to-use "fluent" interface for working with the Dropbox REST API v1.
Dropbox.ChunkedFilesPut Builder for the Dropbox.chunkedUpload(java.lang.String) service.
Dropbox.FilesGet Builder for the Dropbox.filesGet(java.lang.String) service.
Dropbox.FilesPut Builder for the Dropbox.filesPut(java.lang.String) service.
Dropbox.Metadata Builder for the Dropbox.metadata(java.lang.String) service.
Entry Entry describes the meta data of a Dropbox file or folder.
Request Request holds all data for a HTTP(S) REST Request.
Request.Builder The builder for Request instances.
RestClient RestClient defines the interface for a simple HTTP(S) REST client, used by Dropbox and Request.
SimpleRestClient SimpleRestClient is a basic implementation of the RestClient interface, based on java.net so it can be used without problems with Google App Engine.
 

Enum Summary
ThumbFormat Represents the image format of thumbnails that the API can return.
ThumbSize Represents the size of thumbnails that the API can return.
 

Package eu.infomas.dropbox Description

An easy to use, OSGi based Java client for the Dropbox REST API v1, runs on Google App Engine.

The main class in this package is Dropbox. It offers the primary interface (facade) to the Dropbox REST API v1.

Why use this library?

Advantages of using this library instead of the official implementation:
  • Works (and tested) on Google App Engine (this was the primary reason for creating this library)
  • Swappable HTTP Client implementation
  • Smaller library, works default with java.net package
  • More clear (fluent) API
  • Artifact is OSGi compliant bundle
  • Faster because json-smart is used instead of json-simple

Example A. Get the first 8 bytes of a file.

Credentials are stored in a Properties file, format: 
 # .dropbox.config
 # Example Properties files for Dropbox application
 # Application credentials are mandatory
 dropbox.app.key={key}
 dropbox.app.secret={secret token}
 # Access credentials are optional. If not present the API offers operations to 
 # query Access credentials / tokens
 dropbox.access.key={key}
 dropbox.access.secret={secret token}
 # Language is optional, default is "en"
 dropbox.language=nl
If the configuration file (.dropbox.config is stored in your home folder we can start coding: 
 final Dropbox dropbox = new Dropbox("~/.dropbox.config");
 final ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream(8);
 dropbox.filesGet("dropbox file path")
     .withRange(0, 7) // from (inclusive) - to (inclusive)
     .toOutputStream(baos);

Example B. Request meta data for a file or directory.

This example assumes you have your .dropbox.config file in the root of your class path. 
 Dropbox dropbox = new Dropbox("classpath:.dropbox.config");
 Entry entry = dropbox.metadata("/path-to-file-or-directory")
     .withList()
     .asEntry();
 // do something with the Entry
 if (entry.getMimeType.startsWith("image/")) {
     ....
 }

Example C. Upload file, using the chunked upload functionality.

 Dropbox dropbox = new Dropbox("~/.dropbox.config");
 final File fileToUpload = new File("...");
 final Entry entry = dropbox.chunkedUpload("/test/" + fileToUpload.getName())
     .withChunkSize(8)          // use chunks of 8 MB
     .withOverwrite()           // replace existing file (if any)
     .fromFile(fileToUpload);
 LOG.log(Level.INFO, "File uploaded: {0} ({1} bytes)", 
     new Object[]{entry.fileName(), entry.getBytes()});

Since:
infomas-asl 3.0.2

Ronald K. Muller
